title: European Land Use Visualization
summary: An expanded hexagonal map visualization comparing land use across multiple European countries, showing how water, nature, cities, and agriculture are distributed. See what makes Dutch land use special - or not.

title: Can LLMs Recreate Van Gogh's Starry Night Using Only SVG?
summary: An experiment tracking how AI models from 2022 to 2025 have evolved in their ability to recreate famous artworks using SVG. The results reveal how these models understand visual composition and artistic style.

title: A New Metaphor for AI
summary: A post about a better metaphor for AI than the dominant "Terminator" narrative. What we can learn from the history of automata and scientific progress.

title: When AI Fails
summary: A project dedicated to documenting the funny, interesting, and sometimes outright stupid ways in which AI can fail.

title: United Nations Speeches
summary: A side-project that analyzes diplomatic relationships through speeches during the 2024 UN General Assembly.

title: Promotion: Tech Lead GenAI at Rabobank
summary: As Tech Lead GenAI at Rabobank's Wholesale & Rural Innovation department, I lead the technical side of GenAI-driven solutions, focusing on innovation and collaboration to advance agrifinance.

title: Generative Art Gallery
summary: A gallery showing all my generative art projects in one place.

title: Joost van den Vondel's correspondence
summary: An experiment with GenAI to automate manual tasks in creating a critical edition of Joost van den Vondel's correspondence.

image.alt: Screenshot showing an impression of the Vondel correspondence website

title: Ons Land
summary: An interactive data visualization project exploring how land is used across the Netherlands, highlighting the distribution of agriculture, nature reserves, urban areas, and infrastructure throughout the country.

title: Is creativity nothing more than a little randomness?
summary: By using the randomness, AI can generate more surprising and engaging text, similar to how some human thinkers benefit from unconventional approaches. This post explores the concept of randomness in AI and its implications for creativity.

title: Analyzing GPT-4 Tokens
summary: For this article I used Llama3 to analyze GPT-4 tokens, revealing a strong bias towards English and code.

title: AI and the Complexity of Code
summary: Large Language Models like ChatGPT and CoPilot have a dual role in simplifying and complicating software development. Using a simple experiment this post explores how LLMs often lead to an increase in code complexity.

title: Prognosis 2100
summary: Imagining the Netherlands in 2100, this page provides an overview of the impacts of climate change. It's a personal project, driven by my desire to show what the year 2100 could look like when my kids are in their 80s.

title: Displaying Aranet4 CO2 readings on my website

image.alt: Screenshot showing readings of my CO2 monitor

summary: Tutorial on how to display real-time CO2 measurements from an Aranet4 monitor on my website using a Raspberry Pi.

title: Elder Race, book review
summary: I read "Elder Race" by Adrian Tchaikovsky, a sci-fi novel that explores the concept that any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.

image.alt: A high tower with two silhouettes in front of it.

title: Rising Temperatures in The Netherlands
summary: Visualizing the weather anomalies in rainfall, sunshine and temperature in the Netherlands using data from the Dutch Meteorological Institute (KNMI).

image.alt: Graph showing temperature anomalies in the Netherlands

image.alt: A picture of a tree with branches generated by DALL-E

summary: Moving away from the structured Git Flow to a more continuous approach with only one main branch.

title: Git Standup Alias
summary: A git alias to show a standup log for the specified author

title: Accessible router links in Angular
summary: About the routerLink directive and how to make sure it's accessible

title: Progressively enhanced dark mode
summary: Adding a dark theme to my website using NextJS 13 and React Server Components

title: AI Enhanced Education
summary: During the pandemic, I worked on a side project to help parents create lessons for their kids, but it was too time-consuming to create those lessons. Now, with LLMs, I revisited the idea.

title: Why a plant-based diet is a good idea

image.alt: A plant leaf surrounded by a circle of animals and dairy products

summary: My arguments in favor of eating less meat.

title: Guest post by ChatGPT
summary: I asked ChatGPT to write a blog post about its impact on the way developers write code. The contents might surprise you.

summary: A snippet I use to setup the aliases and global git config on new machines.

summary: Some career news! Today I'm joining Rabobank as a frontend lead for the Wholesale & Rural Innovation department.

summary: Part 2 of my tutorial creating "live cursors" as seen in Figma. In this tutorial, I'll be using Phoenix LiveView to create the same feature.

summary: Some advice from the Stoic philosopher Seneca for workers returning to the office after the pandemic.

summary: A tutorial for creating live cursors as seen in Figma. A step-by-step guide focused on beginners (I'm learning Phoenix myself).

title: Adding Tailwind CSS to a Phoenix project
summary: With the official mix task it has become very easy to add Tailwind to any Phoenix project. To make it even more straightforward I've written this quick step-by-step guide.

title: mijn-Lessen.nl
summary: A web app built during the Covid-19 lockdown that helps parents and elementary school children create lessons collaboratively. Parents can support their kids with challenging topics and share interactive educational content with other families. (in Dutch)

title: Vaccination progress
summary: A Twitter bot that tweets the latest vaccination progress for the Netherlands. Recently updated to also show the number of people that received a booster shot.

title: Using Svelte to create a scroll video effect
summary: Tutorial on how to create a scroll video effect using Svelteâ€™s powerful bind command.

title: Tafels.app
summary: A new year, a new JavaScript framework! Using svelte I created this PWA to help my kids with math. The goal was to create an app-like experience, using micro animations, full offline support, prefetching JavaScript and server-side rendering.

title: Programming quotes
summary: A collection of great programming quotes

summary: A first look at the state management library mobx-state-tree and a comparison with Redux Saga.

title: Reading notes Accelerate
summary: Accelerate gives a scientific analysis of what makes IT organizations successful. I've listed the most important ones (from a developer perspective)

summary: Weekend project to learn more about Mobx State Tree. Simple kids' game inspired by Stardew Valley and Monty Python. Don't forget to turn on the sound!

summary: I made this app to test what you can accomplish with current PWA technology (especially on iOS). My kids loved it, I hope you do too! ðŸŽ‰

title: Kamer van Koophandel, Frontend Engineer
summary: At the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KVK), I contributed as a frontend engineer in the development of the application that allows starting entrepreneurs (freelancers) to register their new businesses online. With online registration, the KVK meets the broad societal need to conduct transactions (with government entities) online.

title: Peter and the Wolf
summary: Progressive Web App for kids, based upon the classical piece "Peter and the Wolf" by Prokofiev. Turns out that making large mp3s available offline is harder than I thought.

title: Size of NPM
summary: I thought it might be (mildly) interesting to keep track of how the NPM node_modules folder grows over time. This website keeps track of the size of the top 100 npm packages. It's been running for a while now and the results are... frightening?

title: Work update: Audiobook Player for Dedicon
summary: As a Frontend developer for Stichting Dedicon, I created a player for their audiobook collection. It's built specifically for users with visual impairments.

title: API testing with Jest
summary: Testing async API calls using Jestâ€™s mocking features

title: Tommy Hilfiger, Fullstack Engineer
summary: For Tommy Hilfiger I worked as a full-stack JavaScript engineer on their loyalty app MyTommy. The app is built in React Native for both iPhone and Android, with a restful Node/Express API on the backend.

title: Star Trek
summary: Star Wars or Star Trek? Why not both? Using just CSS and a little bit of JavaScript I recreated these classic science fiction intros.

title: Star Wars
summary: Star Wars or Star Trek? Why not both? Using just CSS and a little bit of JavaScript I recreated these classic science fiction intros.

title: Generating PDF's with Express
summary: A fun little tutorial of how to create a PDF using a web form, Express and PDFKit

title: Words to line prices
summary: A simple web app for translators that converts a price per word to a price per standard line (55 characters).

title: Help Terence!
summary: A Twitter bot raising emoji money for his trip around the world. A fun little experiment with social media and Twitter bots. [no longer active]. Technologies used: Express, MongoDB.

title: Rush hour timelapse
summary: A Twitter bot that creates daily timelapse videos of the traffic jams in the Netherlands. No longer active, but you can still see some of the old time-lapses.

title: Wikipedia edits door de Nederlandse overheid
summary: Twitter bot inspired by @congressedits that monitors and Tweets any edits made to Wikipedia by the Dutch government. It's been in the news quite a few times (de Volkskrant) and the account has more followers than I do. (in Dutch)
